verses.text: Instead of a friend become not an enemy; For \add thereby\add* thou shalt inherit an ill name, shame, and reproach: \add Even\add* so \add shall\add* a sinner that hath a double tongue.
Extol not thyself in the counsel of thine own heart; That thy soul be not torn in pieces as a bull \add straying alone\add*.
Thou shalt eat up thy leaves, And lose thy fruit, And leave thyself as a dry tree.
A wicked soul shall destroy him that hath it, And shall make him to be laughed to scorn of \add his\add* enemies.
Sweet language will multiply friends: And a fair speaking tongue will increase kind greetings.
Be in peace with many: Nevertheless \add have but\add* one counseller of a thousand.
If thou wouldest get a friend, prove him \add first\add*, And be not hasty to credit him.
For \add some man\add* is a friend for his own occasion, And will not abide in the day of thy trouble.
And there is a friend, who being turned to enmity and strife Will discover thy reproach.
Again, \add some\add* friend is a companion at the table, And will not continue in the day of thy affliction.
But in thy prosperity he will be as thyself, And will be bold over thy servants.
If thou be brought low, he will be against thee, And will hide himself from thy face.
Separate thyself from thine enemies, And take heed of thy friends.
A faithful friend \add is\add* a strong defence: And he that hath found such a one hath found a treasure.
Nothing doth countervail a faithful friend, And his excellency is unvaluable.
A faithful friend \add is\add* the medicine of life; And they that fear the Lord shall find him.
Whoso feareth the Lord shall direct his friendship aright: For as he is, so \add shall\add* his neighbour \add be\add* also.
\add My\add* son, gather instruction from thy youth up: So shalt thou find wisdom till \add thine\add* old age.
Come unto her as one that ploweth and soweth, And wait for her good fruits: For thou shalt not toil much in labouring about her, But thou shalt eat of her fruits \add right\add* soon.
She is very unpleasant to the unlearned: He that is without understanding will not remain with her.
She will lie upon him as a mighty stone of trial; And he will cast her from \add him\add* ere it be long.
For wisdom is according to her name, And she is not manifest unto many.
Give ear, \add my\add* son, receive my advice, And refuse not my counsel,
And put thy feet into her fetters, And thy neck into her chain.
Bow down thy shoulder, and bear her, And be not grieved with her bonds.
Come unto her with thy whole heart, And keep her ways with all thy power.
Search, and seek, and she shall be made known unto thee: And when thou hast got hold of \add her\add*, let her not go.
For at the last thou shalt find her rest, And \add that\add* shall be turned to thy joy.
Then shall her fetters be a strong defence for thee, And her chains a robe of glory.
For there is a golden ornament upon her, And her bands are purple lace.
Thou shalt put her on \add as\add* a robe of honour, And shalt put \add her\add* about thee \add as\add* a crown of joy.
\add My\add* son, if thou wilt, thou shalt be taught: And if thou wilt apply thy mind, thou shalt be prudent.
If thou love to hear, thou shalt receive understanding: And if thou bow thine ear, thou shalt be wise.
Stand in the multitude of the elders; And cleave unto him that \add is\add* wise.
Be willing to hear every godly discourse; And let not the parables of understanding escape thee.
\add And\add* if thou seest a \add man\add* of understanding, get thee betimes unto him, And let thy foot wear the steps of his door.
Let thy mind be upon the ordinances of the Lord, And meditate continually in his commandments: He shall establish thine heart, And give thee wisdom at thine own desire.
